name: Shiwei Fang
content: Shiwei Fang Hello! My name is Shiwei Fang and I am currently an Assistant Professor in the School of Computer and Cyber Sciences at Augusta University. Previously, I was a Postdoctoral Research Associate working with Prof. Deepak Ganesan in the College of Information & Computer Sciences at the University of Massachusetts Amherst. I received my Ph.D. in Computer Science from the University of North Carolina (UNC) at Chapel Hill, advised by Prof. Shahriar Nirjon. Prior to my Ph.D., I received B.E. in Computer Engineering from Stony Brook University. My research interest falls under the broad umbrella of Cyber-Physical Systems (CPS), and is driven by the goal of enhancing the sensing and computation capability of low-power, low-cost, and low-maintenance ubiquitous systems that have applications in health, public safety, automation, and beyond. In contrast to developing algorithms based on existing datasets, I look at systems in a pragmatic way, i.e., I build real systems to collect real-world data, examine their characteristics, and push the boundaries of their sensing and computation capabilities. I have fully-funded RA positions available and looking for self-motivated Ph.D. students. Send me an email along with your CV! Education Ph.D. in Computer Science, 2021 The University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill B.E. in Computer Engineering, 2015 SUNY, Stony Brook University News Seventh International Workshop on Data: Acquisition & Analysis in the Era of AI (DATA 2024). I have joined Augusta University. I'm Co-chair the Fifth International SenSys+BuildSys Workshop on Data: Acquisition to Analysis (DATA 2022). Paper accepted to MILCOM 2021. I have joined UMass Amherst as Postdoctoral Research Associate. Received 2021 Horizon Award from UNC. Demo at Sensys 2020. Paper accepted to International Conference on Distributed Computing in Sensor Systems (DCOSS) 2020. Paper presented at International Conference on Embedded Wireless Systems and Networks (EWSN) 2020. Finished internship at Bosch Research and Technology Center, Pittsburgh, PA Best Paper Award at DCOSS 2019, Santorini, Greece!
